history.content:
data 8 is probably 2x easier than 61a. If you find 61a pretty easy, data 8 is going to be a breeze.

With that being said, 61b and 70 is a pretty heavy workload.  if you want to ensure you can declare CS, maybe consider swapping data 8 for a breadth or something.

children.subject: However I would like to point out that based on this semester, I have found technicals to be easier than doing a humanities-based breadth. I have less ensured success with getting a grade I want through writing papers and reading than through an (easier) math based course (i.e. data 8). This is why I'm curious about the Data 8's workload

I'm taking CS61A, EE16A and Data 8 currently, and Data 8 is way easier than the other 2.  I'm headed towards an A. I probably spend less than 2 hours a week on Data 8 without projects, maybe 5 hours a week with projects. But I did learn a lot in this class.  It's less workload than the breadth I'm taking.
Data 8 will probably be easier for you than a humanities breadth. However, if you P/NP the humanities breadth, the breadth will be a lot easier.

Thanks for the input. I’ll definitely consider p/np humanties, but was considering how light data 8 would be alongside the 61b and 70 schedule. I have no fear of declaring but I’m also aiming for high grades in both 61b and 70.
Yes swapping data 8 with a breadth was something I was considering actually which is why I needed more info. Thanks for the input!
I also have AP Stats and apcs experience. Would u say the number of hours suggested by the others above^ basically applies to you too?
Yes! Maybe a bit lighter than the others have mentioned. 3-5 hours/week on average including lectures and projects and homeworks and labs.
Great, thanks for the input! I'll keep Data 8 in my schedule for next semester.
I took data 8 and 61a at the same time first semester. Data 8 was about one fourth of the workload/difficulty of cs61a for me. Keep in mind I had APCS and AP stars in high school.
Update: I got into Anthro 2AC with Lightfoot, so I'll be taking that alongside CS61B and CS70. I'm thinking of taking it for a letter grade. Thanks for all your advice!

history.content: Actually for some reason I can't find a lot of reliable information about this, so I was wondering how much time data 8 generally takes (i.e. what does the workload, and the hours for the workload look like). I heard it's really easy after 61a but just want to quantify hours for the workload too. I'm taking 61A this semester and find it pretty easy (heading towards an A). Also taking Math 54 right now (heading towards an A as of midterm scores), IMT decal, 2 humanities breadths. I'm thinking of taking 61B, 70, and Data 8 for spring.
history.subject: Data 8 workload
